title: Requirements for Dynamic Array - Remove a Single Element Feature

requirements.statement: The Dynamic Array shall provide a method `remove_at(index)` to remove the element at the specified valid index.
The Dynamic Array shall provide a method `remove_element(value)` to remove the first occurrence of the specified value.
The system shall update the JSON file after removal to reflect the new state of the dynamic array.
If the provided index is out of range, the system shall return an error response.
If the provided value does not exist in the array, the system shall return a 'Not Found' error.
The system shall guarantee data integrity when multiple processes access the JSON file concurrently.
The removal operation shall run in O(n) time complexity for arrays up to 1,000,000 elements.
The system shall guarantee atomic write operations to the JSON file to prevent corruption.
The system shall provide meaningful error messages such as 'Index out of bounds' or 'Value not found'.
The implementation shall be compatible with Python â‰¥ 3.9 and work across Linux, Windows, and macOS.

use_case.precondition: JSON file with a valid dynamic array exists.
use_case.trigger: User requests element removal using either `remove_at(index)` or `remove_element(value)`.
use_case.postcondition: JSON file contains the updated dynamic array with the element removed.

acceptance_criteria: Removing by index correctly shifts remaining elements.
Removing by value deletes only the first occurrence of the value.
JSON file remains valid according to RFC 8259.
